content:
‚úÖ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Good simple and fun

‚úÖ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Quite fun and simple enough.

‚úÖ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Good puzzle for Clashing.

Goal section
* Please change ‚Äúthe color of your child‚Äôs eyes‚Äù to ‚Äúthe most probable color of the child‚Äôs eyes‚Äù (added two words and changed one word).

* Suggest to change ‚Äúpossible matches‚Äù to ‚Äúpossible combinations‚Äù or  ‚Äúpossible cases‚Äù.

* Please change ‚Äúthe color of the parents‚Äôs‚Äù to ‚Äúthe colors of the parents‚Äô‚Äù (two words changed).

* Please format ‚ÄúBlue‚Äù, ‚ÄúBrown‚Äù, ‚ÄúGreen‚Äù as {{constants}} instead of [[variables]].

* I suggest to rewrite the longest two paragraphs as the following 4 paragraphs:

If the colors of the parents‚Äô eyes are the same, it is certain that their child‚Äôs eyes will inherit the same color.

If the parents‚Äô eyes are {{Green}} and {{Brown}}, there is a higher probability that their child‚Äôs eyes are {{Brown}}.

In all other cases, there is a chance of around 50% of inheriting the eye color from either parent. You should assume that every odd-indexed child born (index = 1, 3, 5, etc.) will get the color from the first parent, and every even-indexed child (index = 0, 2, 4, 6, etc.) will get the color from the second parent.

Note that indexing starts with {{0}}.

* Suggest to change ‚ÄúMatches :‚Äù to ‚ÄúBelow is a summary of the possible cases:‚Äù

* Please delete ‚Äúto [[N]]‚Äù (as in ‚Äúodd to N‚Äù).

* Please delete ‚Äúto [[N]] , ‚Äù (as in ‚Äúeven to N‚Äù).

(Reason: N is a fixed constant. We do not check whether N is odd or even. In your solution code, you are checking whether i (index) is odd or even.)

Output section
* Please change ‚Äúyour child‚Äù to ‚Äúthe child of each parent of parents, in the same order as input‚Äù

(By the way, jokingly, I won‚Äôt be able to bear 100 children, and my eyes won‚Äôt change colors every time a child is born! So no way they are my children :wink: )

Thanks.

Maybe I did not understand well the goal section, but you mention :
" if index of line is odd to N:
  Brown + Blue -> Brown
  if index of line is even to N :
  Brown + Blue -> Blue"
So, it means :
"     if i%2==0:
            print(color2)        
        else:
            print(color1)
"
But, in your code it is the inverse...

if i%2==0:
            print(color1)
        
        else:
            print(color2)

thank for your suggestions, You'r right, I did not code what I explained,

Cause if i==0, then we talk about the child number 1, and then we should look if (i+1) is odd or even,

The first child will always be odd and then the code looks like:
"
If (i+1) %2==1: print (color1)
else: print (color2)
"

It works because if (i+1) %2==1 then i%2==0 but it's maybe more understable with (i+1) %2==1

thank for you suggestions, i'll apply them :) (it's my first contribution, so i'm glad that you help me in the right way)

For the index / number, to clarify, the first child (that starts from the second line to the nth line) will have the number one , so he will starting as a odd number, the number of the second child will be even and so on.

Thank you for your comment and clarification!

The contribution looks good now. Just one more thing: please delete "Next" in Output section.

Thanks again :)
